content.label: Loved the game until the last update. Won’t load or crashes when it does.

title.label: Hangs after title screen every launch

content.label: Guess I’ll put Grindstone away for a while. The game hangs at the second loading screen (after the title screen) every time I launch it. Oops.

One thing that annoys me is when my health drops, I have to waste so much time to get to the inn to watch a slow animation of the bar tender to fill my health. If there is a option to immediately spend stones to retry, even back on map screen... It would be a 5 star. The gameplay, music, style and difficulty are all perfect.

I wish there was more explanation like a manual. I get that it’s a puzzle game but I feel “in the dark” on some things. If there were a little more explanation I would give this game five stars without hesitation.

title.label: It’s good, but you’ll get stuck on level 26 for a long time

content.label:
Gameplay and graphics are great, but there comes a point where it goes from being a moderately challenging puzzle, to absolutely impossible. 
Deleted the game tonight after being stuck on the same level for a week. 
By the way, I have 3 “gold stars” on each level and 400 grindstones , I’m no slouch when it comes to puzzle games and even this game. This one just takes the cake when it comes to making games “increasingly harder.” 
I will say, that after the update, it seemed like they didn’t release as many skeletons from the tombstones.......I’m thinking this must have be a common complaint. 
Anyway, I’ve lost interest.

I get that some find this game a bit repetitive, that doesn’t bother me, it’s the perfect game to play when you have some time to kill or are only half paying attention to the TV. What bothers me is a bug where random calm creeps will attack you without provocation from time to time, when they are not aggravated. I could be about to finish a level with one heart, set myself near a cluster of calm creeps and then one will attack me at random, ending my run, despite that area being safe at the time. If that’s a feature of the game, it should have been mentioned during the tutorial levels. If it’s a bug, it’s been around for MONTHS and no one has caught it.

title.label: Love this game! Have a suggestion...

content.label: This is one of my favorite iOS games. And I even got my husband, who only plays Best Fiends, to download and play. And now he loves it, too! We have a suggestion. In a future update, please add the ability to change your gear when you first enter a level. That way you won’t have to take the extra time to flee the level and go back to the inn to equip new gear and you can spend more time playing! Thank you!!

I do like this game and find it fun.
But, there are some issues:
1) It crashes a lot.  And, when it does it restarts my whole iPad.
2) There have been a couple of times where something went wrong with the graphics and the enemies couldn’t be seen.  This certainly added a level of complexity to the game, but made it difficult to play.  I deinstalled the game and reinstalled it and it displayed them again.
3) About once per daily grind I do one of the enemies that is not marked as hostile attacks me anyhow.  This is very frustrating as there is no way to predict or avoid friendly ones acting aggressive.

It is fun.  I do like it.  But, it could be better.

title.label: Good Quick Hit Apple Arcade Puzzle Game

content.label:
Enjoy the game quite a bit and have grown to find the mechanic of play quite enjoyable, nuanced, and challenging after initially finding it not too much fun. I’m glad I stuck with it and find I keep coming back to it on my iPhone and iPad. 

I’m also glad they added the daily grind as it’s fun to pick up and play for some relatively quick puzzle action and it’s helped me improve my strategy so I’ve been able to progress through the map levels better.

I do wish the weapons were more prevalent and the recharge cost on some of them (using the in-game resources collected while playing) weren’t so “pricey”.

I’ve had no save issues and I’ve been able to move between my iPhone and iPad with no problems picking up where I left off on the other device via the iCloud save feature. 

This and other quality games that are part of Arcade make the cost per month totally reasonable considering I don’t have all the ads and stupid in game purchases so standard in regular App Store games these days.

title.label: Boring and Grinds your battery most of all

content.label:
I downloaded this as me giving Apple games a last chance to make it worth my while. I wanted some alternative to candy crush/toon blast etc: Casual games that are fun to play in quick opportunities. This game fails to match those for a ton of reasons:
-gameplay is repetitive: 90+levels in, the enemies and objectives never change. The artwork never changes. Level 95 has the exact same action as level 1. Boring. 
-artwork also never changes. 
-takes forever to launch on my iPhone x10s-3x longer than the other games mentioned 
-the battery gets absolutely obliterated. I have no idea HOW they attack my battery like they do, but playing it for too long can destroy your battery
-the things you earn throughout the game “blueprints” are not fun; most consume resources to re-use, but the levels don’t necessitate you needing them, there is no making your character “better.” Or more able to handle other enemies that he will face later. You just just slightly different tools to do the same thing you could before. 

I did give it two stars because the artwork is pretty decent.

 I sure wish they would have had a lot more levels-larger grids, puzzles to resolve, things that felt CRAFTED instead of randomly generated.  

Oh and your text is simultaneously too hard to dismiss and too easy.  Don’t explain how to to defeat the level boss each level. I know how, because it’s exactly the same as the last xx levels.  (Sigh.)

Capy, if you’re reading this: you have half the game you should here. I see you’re launching for switch. Good luck, but if I were you I’d deliver a game that pays off for longer play with things like: more new enemies as it goes on, more different boss fights. (What is this an exit blocking review?) and for the love fix the battery issue and boot times. Why does it take so long???

Really nothing can be improved. Playability, puzzles, difficulty, progression, sound and graphics. 

It’s fantastic and worth the Arcade sub on its own. 

It’s still casual (play 1 minute or 1 hour) and you can swipe over and come back and nothing is lost. Works on airplanes. In the jungle. In a forest. Never need WiFi. 

Nicely done. Thanks.

The game is fun, so I played it for 5 hours straight. Took an hour break, opened the app again and nothing saved.   Absolutely unacceptable that they haven’t fixed this yet, since it has apparently been like this since launch.
It’s a pretty good game, but I’m having a problem with the ‘Daily Grind’ feature and haven’t been able to find a way to send feedback or get support.

title.label: Great game, could use better navigation

content.label:
I’m loving this game! Fun concept and enjoy opportunities to get more bonus loot.

Really REALLY wish I didn’t have to return to the inn for every single weapon or outfit change, or increase health. Can this be accessible at the level entry instead? Makes sense to craft or repair items at the inn, but it’s a giant pain to go back and forth at the start of a new level for things you already have.

title.label: Honestly I love it, but Apple Arcade.

content.label:
I really really love this game, it’s great. I have only one negative for it, Apple Arcade. I only bought one month of Apple Arcade cause I really wanted to try this game and two others. But I don’t see any reason to keep paying for Apple Arcade, in my opinion it’s not worth my money. But I’d be willing to pay for this game, but not monthly like I feel like it is; since this is one of two or three games I like on Apple Arcade. I’d love to see this game
Go on the regular App Store to be purchased for a reasonable price cause I’d love to keep playing it. But once my Apple Arcade is up that’s it, I’m not gonna pay the monthly fee just for grindstone, no matter how great I think it is.

Loving Grindstone!
Great puzzles with so much personality.
The regular updates keep me engaged.  

Keep it up, Capy! Huge fan.

I actually really enjoyed this game. The puzzles were complicated enough to keep it entertaining. There is a wide variety of items and accessories to help you conquer levels, adding a decent element of strategy to the game.

But my single favorite thing this game offers is the incredible soundtrack! The tunes really take this game to a 5 for me. The music can be super relaxing, and adds to the relaxation of slaying creepy monsters!

title.label: Like Pay to Win Only Worse

content.label: Great idea for a game and gameplay is really fun but something needs to change about how you progress. I’m now stuck on a level and I can’t go any further because I’m all out of “Grindstones” and can’t get health. Same as gems or crystals or whatever in game currency, only here you can’t wait for a timer to reset or watch an ad to get more, you just have to play with your health all the way low and get killed right away. Not fun.

Prior to the recent update this was my favorite game ever. It was the only Apple Arcade game I played and I was willing to pay the $5. However since the update you get 4-5 grindstones (gems) for each chest. It used to be 10-40! This is bull crap. You can’t progress with no rewards. I’m canceling my subscription.

I have enjoyed this app since it first came out on the App Store. It’s fun, innovative and progressively challenging. The levels gradually increase in difficulty, just like a game should, BUT it periodically throws in some easier levels too. Even though I’ve played this game for months, it never fails to make me giggle to hear the sound effects at the end of the level when you slap the king to get the crown. I’m grinning just typing this! Kudos to the developers for creating such a fun game and updating it regularly. I plan on checking out other games from this developer because I am so impressed. Great Job!

title.label: Started offline. Lost ALL my progress.

content.label: The promise of Apple Arcade was offline play. Downloaded this to take on a camping trip where I knew there would be no WiFi or cellular data. Great game. Had fun. Made it to level 20. Got home and with my phone on my WiFi launched the game: POOF! It was like I had never played. Back at level 1. All progress lost. It was fun but I’m not going to re-do every level. Pretty bad bug if you ask me.
I had to use screen time to stop myself from playing for hours. An hour or two would go by without me even realizing it. It’s a great challenging puzzle!

Why does this game make u buy from in inn I spent 20 diamonds for a wooden shield that I can only use once and did not want it at all so can u please and a part where you can back out of the inn and not be forced into buying things that you don’t need.

It quickly gets very difficult. I dislike games where your ability to complete a level is largely due to getting a random board that lends itself to creating long chains. Some levels I had to play ten twenty or thirty times before I got a lucky board that worked with my weapon choices.   After a while that gets boring.

This game is just amazing in every way. It’s fun, educational, and silly. I highly recommend to everyone and anyone looking for a new game to play for themselves or their kids. And, I know it says the age rating is what, 13 plus? But it works for all ages if your child is not super afraid of cute monsters popping away when you hit them. As a parent of three, if you just really need a break or it’s screen time for yourself or your kids, “Grindstone” is my go to. Thank you “Apple Arcade” for making it!

Grindstone is a wonderful game that’s perfect for the 10-minute quicky to the hour long “grind.”  Slicing through monsters and finding that one creative route is SO SATISFYING.  The art style’s not too bad, and I’m VERY appreciative that there’s a gore meter to tune it down in case kiddos are watching.  If this were a freemium game, it would be the WORST, but BECAUSE it’s on Apple Arcade, it’s the BEST!
Games like this should be fun. It’s hard to beat levels. It’s like one of those pay to win games but you can’t win.

This is a top tier game. The most unique puzzle game I’ve probably ever played!! I used to be a Jelly Splash fanatic and it seems similar to that, but it’s so much more interesting. I love the concept and the art is amazing. I’m thinking the creators of Star vs the Forces of Evil must’ve had something to do with this, the style reminds me of it heavily. And the music in this game is crazy! Premium game music. The only complaint I have is the inn. It’s annoying that it takes so long to simply refill your hearts, I wish you could get in and get out and not have to wait for the bartender to pour it N u to drink it. I’m sad this is only available on Apple Arcade, I don’t think I could justify paying for it monthly but I would totally buy this game on its own. A shame😢
Fun game... just wish it still worked.

I enjoyed playing this on my phone.  I want to be able to play on my iPad.  Unfortunately it doesn’t seem to keep progress via Game Center.   I’m back at the beginning on my iPad.  I removed the app, logged in and out of Gamecenter, restarted, etc.  No dice.

title.label: Incredibly fun, but incredibly reliant on random luck

content.label: As is probably the nature of the genre, this game can be anywhere from challenging but fair to outright impossible VERY quickly and fairly wary into the game. The levels become too compact to make anything more than a 4-5 combo but are spawned boxed in by multiple enemies requiring 5, 10, or 12 hit combos to kill. I’ve been stuck on level 26, fairly early in, for a long time, and I’m convinced this was not thoroughly playtested. Could use some serious rebalancing but is extremely fun to play otherwise. Really hoping for a tweak in the near future.
Awesome game have no complaints with it besides waiting for the next round of levels!

title.label: How to use the pic axe to destroy boulders

content.label: This seems like a non-issue, but every time I select the pickax I can destroy enemies but the boulders are on unselectable. How am I supposed to destroy boulders when I cannot select them?

Completed the game. Hopefully they add more levels, way to short!

Only 150 levels. 5 star game but nothing to do now.

Update: 5 stars again. Many more levels plus the daily grind. Love the update! Keep the levels coming!!

This was a good game. Unfortunately, this new Daily Grind is really quite stupid. If your purpose was to expand the game and keep players involved, why on earth would you make new levels that have no point to playing them? You keep nothing you earn because it’s all a “sacrifice”. Well, you can sacrifice this game too, because it’s being deleted from my phone.

And the great news is that AA and the developer are able to fix these issues

If you desire player retention, consider doing the following:

For each daily challenge, let the player earn gems or other small randomized items upon completion. Perhaps 5 gems for beating challenge round one, or 8 gems for completing the subsequent challenges...

Why log on everyday? No point...Unless you earn rewards.
Make them small so that people still need to grind.

It’s just frustrating that when visiting earlier levels, it takes too much time to simply earn gems again and buy health.

People have not been able to add anybody to their GC list except since iOS 9. The point is that most people don’t even know who they are competing with.

Other than that, excellent job adding all of the levels, but consider the more appropriate and fitting retention suggestion without a question. 👍😎

I was really enjoying this game, until this last update. Now I have to perform this “daily grind” to gather my “offerings to the gods.” I have to do 4 levels in order to return to the main map and move forward in the game. 

Thanks for killing his game for me. The reason why I gave the stars I did is because I preferred the last version. The last version would’ve earned my 5 star rating.
Hands down the best Apple Arcade game and one of the best iOS games ever.
Obsessed with this game
This is a very fun and addicting game. Additionally the soundtrack is outta sight!!!!! Pleaassasseeee for the love of all things auditory, put the soundtrack on Apple Music!!!!

This game, overall, is great. Mostly, games like this aren’t usually my style. However, the graphics and animations make this game one of the best on Apple Arcade.

The Inn is one of the best parts of the game. The Armory is amazing, and Blueprints are a good addition to the game. The dressing closet is also really cool, but there should probably be more outfits. ( Maybe a winter outfit where Jorj is wearing a super puffy jacket that squishes his face.

But then... there’s the bar. The Bar is useful, and I wouldn’t be at the level I’m at today if it weren’t for the bartender. But there is nothing interesting about it. It has a little animation, and it gives you health. That’s all. 

This is where a suggestion comes in; Bar Fights. You would do a level of medium difficulty, and if you win, you get either a chest, blueprints, or 10 - 20 Grindstones. If you can’t beat the level, you lose a heart. That’s it! Great game overall.

Btw it would be cool if there was something called a Crackhead, maybe a jerk, Idk. But it would basically attack angry creeps and bosses. But if you got too close it can kill you too.

title.label: I finished it and now I need more !!

content.label: I finished the all of the levels on the game and honestly I miss playing it 😭 i haven’t deleted the app bc i don’t wanna lose my prohress but i might so that I can start over 😂 please make a second game or come out with new levels please. I love it so much!!
I love u, can’t get enough 🥺🥺

There’s just one thing I’d like.

It’s annoying to have to go back to the inn to replenish lives.

I’d like an option to auto-replenish my lives after each level, as long as I have the 5 or 10 gems needed.

It’s visual and auditory experience is incredible.  The music track sounds like it was composed by Trent Reznor for an ID Software game.  I don’t gravitate towards candy crush type puzzle games but this one is fantastic. Great job, devs. Give it a try.

Also one of my favorite Arcade games. It was always so satisfying to complete levels and try to win all the challenges. Again never really frustrating to play which is always a turn off for me with games. Hoping for a sequel one day.
not seeing these new levels 😪

title.label: Great concept but drawbacks take away from the fun...

content.label: This game is fun, but once you reach a difficult level you are forced to go back to lesser levels and earn “stones” in order to gain enough health to go back and tackle the hard levels. If they would allow the character to heal up between matches like some of the power ups rather than “pay” stones to heal back up it would be more addictive. I usually reach a difficult level and begin to run out of stones in order to keep playing. The thought of going back to early lesser levels becomes unappealing and I stop playing. The potential is there because graphics are great and the game play is fun unfortunately part of the game play keeps players from grinding on this game.  One other drawback is that upgrades cost  significant amounts of your inventory items (some of which are the stones required to gaining health) so it’s this endless cycle of trying to gain items to continue on playing and upgrading your stuff rather than advancing through the levels. Awesome concept for a game but too many small things keep you from REALLY enjoying it.
Best game on Arcade. One of the best mobile games of all time. Great art style great game play and quite funny times. Love it!

title.label: Best casual game since Plants vs Zombies

content.label: A fantastic puzzle/strategy/action(?) game. Extremely satisfying and addictive. Best iOS game I’ve played in a long while. A little tricky on iPhone but much better on iPad. A must-play!
